Event:
...

The main event in this post is the individual's struggle with self-harm and their recent decision to give up their blades to their boyfriend for safekeeping. The event can be described as a negative experience (depression) that occurred as a result of the individual's previous reliance on self-harm as an unhealthy outlet, but which is now no longer accessible to them.
Post: "I've been struggling with self-harm for so long, and I finally decided to give up my blades to my boyfriend for safekeeping. It's like, I know I shouldn't be relying on this unhealthy coping mechanism anymore, but it's hard to let go of the only thing that's helped me feel in control when everything else seems to be falling apart. I'm trying to move forward and find healthier ways to deal with my depression, but it's scary to think that I might not be able to handle life's challenges without my blades. I guess this is what they mean by 'global attributional style' - the way we attribute meaning to events in our lives can either help us or hurt us. In this case, I'm trying to reframe my thinking and see that giving up my blades doesn't mean I'm weak or incapable, but that I'm strong enough to face my problems head-on and find new ways to overcome them."

Event: My parents left me without a father figure when I was born, and I have been feeling lonely and isolated since then.
